Name: Albert
Description: German-born theoretical physicist best known for developing the theory of relativity and the equation E=mc². He received the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921 for his explanation of the photoelectric effect.
location: Ulm, Kingdom of Württemberg, German Empire

Name: Marie
Description: Polish-born scientist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and remains the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences — Physics and Chemistry.

Name: J. Robert
Description: American theoretical physicist known as the 'father of the atomic bomb' for his role as scientific director of the Manhattan Project during World War II. Later advocated for international control of nuclear power.
